alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Lower Jefferson; Northern Jasper; Northern Newton; Northern Orange; Southern Jasper; Southern Newton; Southern Orange; Tyler; Upper Jefferson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 8:26PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Dangerous Black Ice on Bridges and Overpasses Will Continue... Despite the wintry precipitation of freezing rain, freezing drizzle, and sleet ending in some locations, and will be ending for the entire area overnight, residual moisture and air temperatures well below freezing will keep conditions icy on bridges and overpasses through the night into mid to late Tuesday morning. This situation known as black ice or invisible ice is a deadly driving hazard as this patchy ice on roadways can not easily be seen. Likely sunny and breezy conditions on Tuesday morning should melt and evaporate the ice. Travel is not recommended tonight into Tuesday morning over bridges and overpasses and some bridges and overpasses have been closed. Check with local officials on these closures. For Louisiana road conditions go to www.511la.org For Texas road conditions go to www.drivetexas.org
